snippet: Alex Salmond, Scotland’s first minister, wants a referendum in 2014, counting on a surge in nationalist feelings stirred by memories of the Battle of Bannockburn against the English in 1314.
abstract: Alex Salmond, Scotland’s first minister, has anchored his hopes of winning backing for independence from England on a surge in the nationalist feelings stirred by memories of Bannockburn; he has outlined a schedule that would see the referendum held in the autumn of 2014, when the 700th anniversary of the 1314 battle, which first assured Scots of independence, will be commemorated with festivities that will be replicated in every corner of Scotland.
lead_paragraph: Alex Salmond, Scotland’s first minister, wants a referendum in 2014, counting on a surge in nationalist feelings stirred by memories of the Battle of Bannockburn against the English in 1314.

headline.seo: Scottish Leader Pins Hopes for Independence Vote on a 700-Year-Old Fervor
headline.main: Pinning Scottish Independence on a Fervor for 1314
